Name: Text
Description: Retrieve (GET) or save (POST) texts to the system.

Parameters.desc: text_id is a unique key for your content. It must be an alphanumeric string, maximum length is 64 characters. If group_id is provided, it will be prefixed with the group id, i.e. each group has namespace of its own for text ids.
Group id for texts (alphanumeric string, recommended max length 32 characters). If provided, all text ids in group are visible only in the group (e.g. text ids won't collide between groups).
Language id (int). The human language text provided is written in. E.g. 1 = English (GB), 11 = Finnish. Please refer to /languages/-method for full list of language ids.
Text: either source text to translate or previously made translation you want to save into our system. May contain HTML or any other markup.

A boolean value (1/0;on/off) which controls if translations are trashed or not. E.g. if you make a spelling error correction to the original text, you probably don't want to trash the translations and re-translate the text. Also if you save previously made translation to our system using this method, it's really important to set invalidate_translations off!
A boolean value (1/0;on/off) which controls if translations is a draft or not. Draft translations are checked by a translator when translation request is placed.
Authentication token which can be acquired with valid transfluent.com account credentials using authenticate-method

Name: TextStatus
Description: Check if text has been translated to specified language.

Parameters.desc: text_id is a unique key for your content. It must be an alphanumeric string, maximum length is 64 characters. If group_id is provided, it will be prefixed with the group id, i.e. each group has namespace of its own for text ids.
Group id for texts (alphanumeric string, recommended max length 32 characters). If provided, all text ids in group are visible only in the group (e.g. text ids won't collide between groups).
Language id (int). The human language text provided is written in. E.g. 1 = English (GB), 11 = Finnish. Please refer to /languages/-method for full list of language ids.
Authentication token which can be acquired with valid transfluent.com account credentials using authenticate-method
Group id for texts (alphanumeric string, recommended max length 32 characters). If provided, all text ids in group are visible only in the group (e.g. text ids won't collide between groups).
Language id (int). The human language text provided is written in. E.g. 1 = English (GB), 11 = Finnish. Please refer to /languages/-method for full list of language ids.
POST-only. Array of text keys and content. Either JSON array (string; e.g. {"foo": "Foooooooooooooooo", "bar": "Bar"}) or a POST parameter array (e.g. texts[foo]=Foooooooo&texts[bar]=Bar).

A boolean value (1/0;on/off) which controls if translations are trashed or not. E.g. if you make a spelling error correction to the original text, you probably don't want to trash the translations and re-translate the text. Also if you save previously made translation to our system using this method, it's really important to set invalidate_translations off! Warning! Affects ALL texts set on the same request. If you need to invalidate some and keep others, you have to perform two requests.
Authentication token which can be acquired with valid transfluent.com account credentials using authenticate-method

Name: TextsTranslate
Description: You can order translations for new and changed texts by calling this method.

Parameters.desc: Group ids are used to create separated namespaces for multiple projects to avoid unintended text_id collisions (e.g. "project_slash")
Language id (int) or language code (string). Language of source text. E.g. en-gb or 1 for English. Please refer to /languages/-method for full list of language ids and codes.

Target languages to translate texts into. Provide language ids/codes as an JSON-array (e.g. [1,4,11] or ["fi", "fr"]) or use post fields (target_languages[]=1&target_languages[]=4&target_languages[]=11 or target_languages[]=fi&target_languages[]=fr). Please refer to /languages/-method for full list of language ids and codes.
Texts to translate. Provide array as string (JSON: [{"id":"my_text_id"},{"id":"some_another_key"}]) or post fields (texts[][id]=my_text_id&texts[][id]=some_another_key)
Context information and other relevant information to the translator
Callback URL which will be called once translation is completed. Please see:- Callbacks
To avoid surprisingly costly orders, you can specify maximum word count to order. If limit is exceeded, the order will fail.
This parameter has been deprecated and will be removed soon.
Translator level: economy, native, business or expert. Default is business [translator]. Valid values are: eco|economy|pro|business|native
Deliver ready translation by email in addition to possible callback.
If $deliver_by_email is true, deliver to this address instead of the customer address.
Title for the project to identify it on delivery. Usage depends on order source and delivery method
Authentication token which can be acquired with valid transfluent.com account credentials using authenticate-method
